subject: p11906222
Findings: As compared to the previous examination, the patient has been intubated. The tip of the endotracheal tube projects 37 cm above the carina. The patient also has received a nasogastric tube, the course of the tube is unremarkable, the tip of the tube does not display on the image. The ventriculoperitoneal shunt and the left subclavian access line are unchanged. There is no evidence of complications, notably no pneumothorax. The lung volumes are increased, with subsequent decrease in severity and extent of a pre-existing right basal medial parenchymal opacity. No newly appeared parenchymal opacities, unchanged size of the cardiac silhouette. No pleural effusions.
